The hyper2 package

Overview

The hyper2 package gives a suite of methods for creating and analysing likelihood functions generated from a generalization of the Bradley-Terry probability model. The package uses the STL map class of C++ for efficiency; it conforms to disordR discipline.

Installation

The released version of hyper2 on CRAN may be installed with:

# install.packages("hyper2")  # uncomment this to install the package
library("hyper2")

Further information

For more detail, see the package vignette; type

vignette("hyper2")

at the R command line.

Citation

To cite the hyper2 package in publications, please use

Robin K. S. Hankin 2017. “Partial rank data with the hyper2 package: Likelihood functions for generalized Bradley-Terry models”. The R Journal, 9(2):429–439
